clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Effect of Intravenous Lidocaine Infusion on Postoperative Pain Treatment and Bowel Function in Robotic Bowel Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Double Blind Prospective Investigation of the Effect of Intravenous Lidocaine Infusion on Postoperative Pain Treatment and Bowel Function in Robotic Bowel Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Single center double blind randomised controlled trial. 60 subjects. Giving lidocaine IV or saline to patients due to robot assisted colorectal surgery. Primary outcome is cumulative morphine consumption at 24 hours.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective double blind randomised controlled trial. The investigators are giving lidocaine IV or saline to 60 patients undergoing robot assisted colorectal surgery. Blinding and randomization is done by the hospital pharmacy. Both groups get otherwise the same treatment and a IV PCA (patient controlled administration) morphine pump for objectivisation of opioid consumption. Other outcome measures are NRS (numerical rating score) pain score, PONV (postoperative nausea and vomiting), use of antiemetics and opioid consumption up to 72 hours.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 2 randomized groups, one getting lidocaine and the other getting saline
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Pharmacy provides the research medicine, it is not possible to see a difference. The envelopes are "encrypted". The randomization will only be broken in the end.

primary_outcome.description: PCA morphine added to PN (per necessitae) morphine, cumulated

secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative nausea and vomiting - patient is asked
PCA morphine added to PN morphine, cumulated
time to flatus or defecation or function of bowel stoma

arm_group.description: Patient gets the experimental treatment with IV lidocain 0,5mg/ml, 1,5mg/kg bolus before induction of anesthesia, after that infusion of 1,5mg/kg/h is started and continued until 2 hours after end of surgery.
Patients get the same amount in ml and duration as if it was the experimental arm. Only in this arm it is isotonic saline instead.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients due to robotic laparoscopic colorectal surgery, > 18years of age, danish speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- allergy to lidocain or amid local analgetics, atrioventricular blok, liver- and/or kidney failure, chronic use of opioids or NSAIDS, pregnancy, breastfeeding women, treatment with betablockers, porphyria
